title: New Win11 Laptop Install of Thunderbird and "Settings" will not show
content:

Today, I tried to go into Thunderbird Settings (NOT Account Settings). if I go through the menu Tools \ Settings. Nothing happens. Use the ||| on the taskbar, NOTHING HAPPENS. Open "Account Settings" and go down to * Thunderbird Settings, NOTHING HAPPENS. Tried using Troubleshooting and restart with no change.

I also reverted back to the original Profile that was the default when it installed. I then imported from my other profile saved off. Same deal, cannot open Settings. (Tried before Import and after).

What have I done wrong? What can I try and massage to get the window to show?

title: OAuth2 for IMAP/SMTP Bug - Not Challenged for Credentials
content:
I've used Thunderbird with multiple Google Workspace accounts before - but I've found the account configuration process to be very inconsistent.

All three accounts require OAuth2 authentication - all use the same IMAP and SMTP servers.

Adding the first account works perfectly - every time. It's when I go to add the second account that I start encountering issues.

I'll see one of two things happen:

1. A browser window will instantiate but it will attempt to use the login from the first account to authenticate the mailbox for the second account. Obviously that's not going to work, so I cancelled out of the authentication workflow.

2. Now that I've cancelled the authentication workflow, Thunderbird attempts to use basic auth each and every time. I've deleted the account and tried adding it back again. No luck.

I've had this working on a couple of other Windows computers. But, as mentioned at the onset, the behavior was very inconsistent.

Now, I'm setting up a new computer and I'm stuck.

From what I've seen in other email clients - they seem to understand that each mailbox will require unique credentials.

They do not attempt to reuse OAuth2 tokens for subsequent mailboxes. Instead, they restart the authentication workflow for each account - which is the behavior I would expect with Thunderbird as well.

This seems like a bug. I'm not sure how to troubleshoot it any further.

This is with version 128.3.2esr on Windows 11 (24H2).

title: Problema con l'importazione delle impostazioni desktop su Thunderbird per Android
content:
Ciao a tutti,

Sto cercando di importare le mie configurazioni di Thunderbird dalla versione desktop (su Mac e Windows) alla versione mobile su Android. Ho seguito la guida ufficiale (https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-android-import), che indica di andare su "Strumenti > Esportazione mobile" dal desktop. Tuttavia, non riesco a trovare questa opzione, vedo solo "Esporta", che mi permette di generare un file ZIP di configurazione.

Ho provato entrambe le versioni stabile e release di Thunderbird, pensando che la funzione potesse essere presente solo in una versione specifica o beta, ma senza successo.

Qualcuno ha avuto lo stesso problema o può indicarmi se questa funzione è stata rinominata o se c'è un altro metodo per importare le configurazioni su Android?

Grazie mille per l'aiuto!
